title: Coronavirus: False claims test kits for ‘Covid-19’ were sold in 2017
description: Our latest debunk of misinformation includes claims about the World Bank, thermometers and llamas.

title: Week in pictures: 5-11 September 2020
description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

title: Living with IBD: Ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease
description: BBC reporter Bryony Hopkins explores how IBD impacts the lives of three young people.

title: Migrants on Lesbos: 'Europe does not exist. This is hell'
description: The migrants and refugees are now sleeping wherever they can after the camp burned to the ground.

title: I read all those Trump tell-alls. Here's what I learned
description: With yet more books offering fresh info on Trump, what do you get when you take them together?

title: What 'back to school' looks like around the world
description: After months of virtual learning, some schools have now reopened their doors to pupils. But with the ongoing risk of coronavirus, what does the average school day now look like?

title: Pregnancy loss: ‘He wasn’t with me when we got the bad news’
description: A couple who suffered miscarriage during lockdown want "clearer" rules around hospital visits.

title: Defence secretary denies plan to mothball British army tanks
description: But Ben Wallace admits a security review will mean "letting go" of some military equipment.

title: Typewriter artist James Cook's first exhibition features Hollywood stars
description: James Cook uses the characters of a typewriter to create likenesses of Tom Hanks and Bill Murray.

title: England v Australia: Josh Hazlewood and Adam Zampa star in tourists' win
description: Pace bowler Josh Hazlewood and spinner Adam Zampa take combined figures of 7-81 as Australia beat England by 19 runs in the first one-day international at Old Trafford.

title: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire: Teacher beats brother to win jackpot
description: Donald Fear is the first person to win the Who Wants To Be A Millionaire jackpot in 14 years.

title: Lockdown for a second time: 'It can't get any worse'
description: How are firms in Bolton - many of which have just reopened - coping with the new local restrictions?

title: Coronavirus: How will it affect my pregnancy, scans and the birth?
description: The way some maternity care is delivered has changed to cope with the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus cases on the rise in the UK
description: New estimates show cases increasing since the end of August, particularly among young people.

title: Coronavirus: Face masks in shops to be mandatory in Wales
description: Wales' first minister says people flouting the new restrictions could face a fine of £1,920.

title: Brexit: Trade talks hang in balance as UK rejects EU ultimatum
description: Ministers say they will not scrap plans to override withdrawal treaty despite pressure from some Tory MPs.

title: Newquay police officer seriously injured in attack
description: A 30-year-old man from Newquay is arrested on suspicion of the attempted murder of a police officer.

title: Coronavirus: Tory MPs criticise 'rule of six' decision
description: One ex-minister says it was "outrageous" new rules were made "without consultation" of Parliament.

title: Over 500,000 flee 'unprecedented' Oregon fires
description: At least one of the deadly infernos in the western US state is being treated as possible arson.

title: Coronavirus: England and Wales' contact-tracing app gets launch date
description: Matt Hancock describes it as a "defining moment" in the effort to control the spread of Covid-19.

title: The Painted Bird: Stellan Skarsgård on the film's 'brutal violence'
description: Stellan Skarsgård discusses the "brutal violence" of the film which shocked audiences in Venice.

title: UK economy continues recovery in July
description: The economy expanded by 6.6%, but the country's growth remains far below pre-pandemic levels.

title: UK signs first major post-Brexit trade deal with Japan
description: Symbolic trade deal will cover 99% of UK exports to Japan but boost economy by just 0.07%.

title: Rule of six is ‘hammer’ blow for holiday cottages
description: Firms offering self-catering properties say new coronavirus rules "pull the rug" from under the sector.

title: Coronavirus: 'Rule of six' hits larger families
description: Big families react as they are told gatherings of more than six will be banned in England from Monday.

title: Amazon: Brazilian official killed by arrow near indigenous tribe
description: Rieli Franciscato, who worked to protect tribes, was hit in the chest near an indigenous site in Brazil.

title: Players confused as fans boo 'moment of unity' at NFL opener in Kansas
description: Pockets of fans are heard booing a 'moment of unity' as protests against racism take place on the opening night of the NFL season.

title: Basketball star with brain tumour has Nike Air Jordan trainer collection stolen
description: The collection of 52 shoes were taken from basketball star Mike Marti as he recovered from a brain tumour.

title: Cardiff woman stole £76k suitcase of designer clothes from train
description: Hajar Al Fahad learned the victim was wealthy after striking up a conversation with her on a train.

title: Williams beaten by Azarenka in US Open semi-final
description: Serena Williams' latest bid for a 24th Grand Slam singles title ends as Victoria Azarenka rolls back the years to reach the US Open final.
